message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is about contextual automatic speech recognition, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and speech processing. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with phonemes, which are a fundamental unit of speech, and thus cs.SD (Sound) is also a likely sub-category. The paper involves modeling and biasing techniques, which are related to machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI a possible sub-category. The paper also deals with cross-lingual speech recognition, which involves language translation and language modeling, making cs.LG (Learning) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves contextual biasing, which is related to information retrieval and search algorithms, making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) a possible sub-category.
